greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Characteristic function of numbers that are the product of consecutive primes.
comment: More exactly: characteristic function of squarefree numbers with no gaps in their prime factorization. - _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 15 2017
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Array[Boole[Or[# == 1, PrimeQ[#], Union@ Differences@ PrimePi@ Flatten@ Map[ConstantArray[#1, #2] & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#] ] == {1} ] ] &, 105] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 16 2017 *)
program: a192280 n = fromEnum $ a053590 n == n

(PARI) A192280(n) = { if(1==n,return(1)); if(!issquarefree(n),return(0)); my(ps=factor(n)[,1], pis=vector(length(ps),i,primepi(ps[i])), diffsminusones = vector(length(pis)-1,i,(pis[i+1]-pis[i])-1)); !vecsum(diffsminusones); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 15 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 26 2011
